update.description:
This is a resurrection of pull request #1825 from @jlee02, that adds support for dart5 to gazebo8. This is an intermediate step towards supporting dart6, which has already been released. I figured that splitting it into two pull requests would make the review easier.

There are a few tests that are disabled due to known issues (not supporting ray sensor or pr2's closed kinematic loops) and one new test failure of the sonar sensor (#2062). On the bright side, some improvements were made to rigid body rotations, so that a portion of the physics_link test can pass without relaxed tolerances.

A jenkins job has been queued:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_dart4-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia_docker/28
update.title: Support Dart5 in gazebo8

content.raw: cache isn't cleared here either
content.html: cache isn't cleared here either

content.raw: It doesn't look like the cache is actually cleared by this function.
content.html: It doesn't look like the cache is actually cleared by this function.

content.raw: I tested changing it to a warning and it will print even when working properly. If anything it's a commentary about the lifecycle expectations for derived physics classes: some are created in the base constructor, while others aren't created until the `Init` function. So it may be useful for when we redesign the physics API, but shouldn't affect end users. So I think `gzlog` is ok.
content.html: I tested changing it to a warning and it will print even when working properly. If anything it's a commentary about the lifecycle expectations for derived physics classes: some are created in the base constructor, while others aren't created until the Init function. So it may be useful for when we redesign the physics API, but shouldn't affect end users. So I think gzlog is ok.

content.raw:
I got a crash in a simple setting:

1. Open Gazebo: `gazebo --verbose -e dart`
1. Insert a cylinder
1. Delete the cylinder, error:

~~~
***** Internal Program Error - assertion (dartLink2.get() != nullptr) failed in virtual void gazebo::physics::DARTPhysics::UpdateCollision():
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTPhysics.cc(150): dartLink2 in collision pair is null
~~~
content.html:
I got a crash in a simple setting:

  1. Open Gazebo: gazebo --verbose -e dart
  2. Insert a cylinder
  3. Delete the cylinder, error:
***** Internal Program Error - assertion (dartLink2.get() != nullptr) failed in virtual void gazebo::physics::DARTPhysics::UpdateCollision():
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTPhysics.cc(150): dartLink2 in collision pair is null

content.raw:
I assume the error message here because this doesn't work any more, unlike other deprecated functions which still work, but will be removed in the next release.

I wonder if we should just remove this instead of deprecating...

content.raw:
I'm not being able to build this. I installed `libdart-core5-dev` but I'm getting errors like:

~~~
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTTypes.hh:52:23: error: ‘Properties’ is not a member of ‘dart::dynamics::BodyNode’
       std::shared_ptr<dart::dynamics::BodyNode::Properties>;
~~~

Am I missing something? Or am I just in a bad state?
content.html:
I'm not being able to build this. I installed libdart-core5-dev but I'm getting errors like:

/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTTypes.hh:52:23: error: ‘Properties’ is not a member of ‘dart::dynamics::BodyNode’
       std::shared_ptr<dart::dynamics::BodyNode::Properties>;

Am I missing something? Or am I just in a bad state?
